intro: Schrankia nuttallii var. hystricina, commonly known as the Nuttall's Schrankia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which help it conserve water in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals that are often pink or purple in color. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
